security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and AI instructions. No executable code, no network operations, no command execution, no credential access. The skill describes invoking Claude API for HTML generation but contains no actual code that could be malicious.

content.user_title: Convert PDF Pages to Semantic HTML
content.value_statement: Manually converting PDF pages to semantic HTML is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill uses AI to automatically generate semantic HTML5 from PDF pages with three sources of context for high accuracy.
actual_capabilities: Generate semantic HTML5 from PDF pages using AI
Process PNG images, JSON text data, and ASCII previews together
Apply consistent CSS class naming conventions
Validate text coverage to prevent AI hallucination
Create metadata logs for generation tracking
Output properly structured HTML with semantic elements
limitations: Requires three specific input files from previous extraction skills
Output is probabilistic and may need verification
Cannot process encrypted or password-protected PDFs
Visual accuracy depends on PNG image quality

use_cases.title: Document Accessibility
use_cases.description: Convert textbook chapters to accessible HTML for screen readers and web display with proper semantic markup.

use_cases.title: PDF Content Migration
use_cases.description: Migrate PDF documentation to web-ready HTML with consistent class names and structured formatting.

use_cases.title: Digital Publishing
use_cases.description: Transform printed materials into digital formats with proper heading hierarchies and semantic elements.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the attached PDF page to semantic HTML5. Use the PNG image for layout, the JSON data for text accuracy, and the ASCII preview for structure.

prompt_templates.title: With Coverage Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate HTML that includes every word from the source JSON. Do not add any bridging text or transitional phrases between pages.

prompt_templates.title: Semantic Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create semantic HTML with proper heading hierarchy (h1 to h4), list structures, and CSS classes. Use classes like page-container, section-heading, paragraph, and bullet-list.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Modal Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the PNG image for visual layout, use the JSON for exact text content, and follow the ASCII preview for element relationships. Generate HTML5 that accurately recreates the page.

output_examples.input: Convert Chapter 2, Page 16 to semantic HTML
output: Includes page-container wrapper and page-content main element
Applies chapter-header with chapter-number and chapter-title
Uses proper heading hierarchy (h1 â†’ h2 â†’ h3 â†’ h4)
Wraps bullet lists in ul.bullet-list with li.bullet-item

best_practices: Run the verification script after each page generation to catch AI hallucination early
Use all three input sources (PNG, JSON, ASCII) for complete context
Check coverage percentage is between 99-100% before proceeding to the next page
Do not consolidate chapters until all individual pages pass the verification gate
anti_patterns: Skipping the text verification step and proceeding to consolidation
Accepting coverage above 100% which indicates the AI added invented content
Consolidating pages with any coverage below 95%
Allowing the AI to add bridging text between page boundaries

faq.question: Which AI models support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires vision capabilities for the PNG image input and text generation for the HTML output.

faq.question: What happens if text coverage is below 95%?
faq.answer: Coverage below 95% indicates missing content. Regenerate the page and re-run verification. Never proceed with pages that fail the quality gate.

faq.question: Can this skill process scanned PDFs without text layers?
faq.answer: No. This skill requires rich_extraction.json from a previous text extraction skill. Scanned images need OCR processing first.

faq.question: Is my document data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Document data is only sent to the configured AI API endpoint. No data is collected or stored by this skill itself. See your AI provider's privacy policy.

faq.question: Why does the verification sometimes show over 100% coverage?
faq.answer: Coverage above 100% means the AI added words not present in the source. This is hallucination. Regenerate with stricter boundary instructions.

faq.question: How is this skill different from other PDF converters?
faq.answer: This skill uses three sources of context (visual, textual, structural) instead of a single input. It applies semantic CSS classes and includes validation gates to prevent errors.
